step1.sentence: I told my best friend about the surprise party because I knew she could keep a secret.

step2.story: Maya found out that her coworker was planning to resign next month. He begged her to keep a secret until he was ready to tell the team himself. She promised and didn't say a word, even when others asked why he seemed distant lately.

step3.story: When Jisoo was twelve, her grandmother whispered something surprising — she had once been a professional dancer before the family moved abroad. Grandmother smiled softly and said, "Can you keep a secret for me?" Jisoo nodded eagerly, feeling proud that she was trusted with such a special story. For years, she never told anyone, not even her parents. Then one day at a family reunion, grandmother stood up and performed a graceful dance that left everyone speechless. Jisoo grinned from ear to ear, knowing she had kept the secret perfectly until the right moment.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 비밀을 유지하다, 즉 다른 사람에게 알려지지 않도록 정보를 간직하다라는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 누군가에게 들은 이야기나 알게 된 정보를 다른 사람에게 말하지 않겠다는 약속이나 능력을 나타낼 때 씁니다. 'Can you keep a secret?'처럼 비밀을 털어놓기 전에 확인하는 표현으로도 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: keep은 고대 영어 cēpan(지키다, 보관하다)에서 유래했고, secret은 라틴어 secretum(숨겨진 것)에서 왔습니다. 비밀을 '보관하다'라는 직관적인 조합입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 신뢰와 관련된 표현으로, 이 표현을 잘 지키는 사람은 믿을 수 있는 사람으로 여겨집니다. 반대로 'can't keep a secret'이라고 하면 입이 가벼운 사람이라는 부정적 뉘앙스가 됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Don't worry — I can keep a secret.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 걱정 마 — 나는 비밀을 잘 지켜.
